column4: I click 'enable desktop effects' and it tells me 'desktop effects could not be enabled'.  where can I find more information?  I don't see any 'details' button.
check if your video card is compatible with the features desktop effects gives
I've used it with beryl in dapper and sid
maybe it is a bug, it does that for me too. but i just use beryl instead
I just tried using the feisty live CD on a different PC
I'm trying to use a live CD, but it just won't keep anything I do.
keep? as in save??? ...settings and config?
as in anything, yes.  like the graphic card drivers, for example.
the dapper liveCD would read and write settings to my memory stick

it is because it is a trial, you have not set up a drive to actually save these things. The live cd will run it, but until you point the OS to a place to save things (this doesn't count in the live cd)...it needs a ext2 or ext3 filesystem to save to, which you haven't set up
is some extra set up needed?  I set it up for dapper already.
but your running the live cd, right? if its on your memory stick..hmm...it isn't saving things to it now?
dapper saves everything you do to the 'casper-rw' partition of the memory stick, if one exists.  I can't get feisty to do the same.  I'm talking about the live CD, yes.
interesting, i have no idea. give a shout and see if someone else would know why
it's a useful thing to have - it means I can take my ubuntu install from pc to pc - I use quite a lot of different (windows) machines, you see
i dont know how pen drives operate with the live cd, it isn't something i've had to learn yet...good luck.
